Are there specific examples of your perf:
I'd like to bring awareness to some of my most proud accomplishments at Ennead Architects:

1. Provisioned the following security solutions:
Defender for Endpoint (many integrations across azure and devices)
Defender for Cloud Apps (integrated)
SIEM - Sentinel (single pane of glass view of all processes with automations)
Defender for Identity (critical risk protection integrated with Conditional access)
Defender for Office 365 
Mobile app protection (personal device access to Ennead resources)
Purview (DLP, AIP) (ongoing))
Threat Intelligence integrations (SIEM, MDE, MDCA, SIEM)
Conditional access (MFA, Risk blocking and Data loss prevention integrations and more)
Ransomware protections with OneDrive for Business rollout (company-wide)
Custom alerting and automations around risky users
Web content and AI rule mitigations
Daily, weekly and monthly security reviews and responses to many events including malware, content blocking and MITRE attack mitigations
Enterprise app and app registration reviews and support

2. Infrastructure:
Migrated Newforma from on-premises into Azure hosted IAAS platform
Deployed fusion connect IP Telephony integrations with Teams (handled all Azure and M365 integrations in collaboration with a team member)
OneDrive for Business implementation company wide
Repaired hundreds of broken tokens across all company workstations (mandatory to manage devices and to secure devices into the cloud)
Rolled out MECM and integrated MECM with Intune (remote control, device repair and detailed asset reporting funneled into Intune)
Windows 11 upgrades (ongoing)
Argos migrations (ongoing)
Printer server migration to the cloud (ongoing)
Desktop support
Application packaging including custom built application such as Drive Mapper and others

3. Other
Daily 3rd level support for business teams fielding many requests to resolve issues, provide access to users, repair items
Daily administration of Email, calendars, guest users (partner access)
Resolved many issues with internal systems emailing and alerting such as Newforma and NetApp monitoring
Support ticket troubleshooting and resolution
Custom solutions such as EPM (users can elevate specific apps to administrator for specific use cases ) (ongoing))
Shanghai migration project (Ongoing)
Custom requests such as eDiscovery or assisting partners to access systems
Areas for Growth / Development Goals: Acquire certifications in AI and or AI security
Collaboration Comments: I make strong efforts to collaborate with functional verticals within the organization. Many of the infrastructure and security efforts require close collaboration between separate areas of the business. This survey is a good example of how I collaborated with my team, HR and Studio developers to develop an automated solution. I make strong efforts to inform my leadership, peers and users on all my projects and tasks. I often respond to requests off typical business hours if needed and have done so many times in service on Ennead Architects users and project owners.
Communication Comments: My role is highly dependent on effective use of time, and I leverage tools and automation as much as possible to assist in the internal communications of our IT support needs.
Please share your thoughts about the cha: Ennead is a really wonderful company with technology growing pains like many organizations. It would be helpful if we had better communication when challenges arise with the studio so I can better serve the needs of the business.
Professionalism Comments: I pride myself on being very reliable and I have a very strong work ethic with integrity. My team and leadership know how I bring my best attitude and effort in providing good security solutions.
Software & Tools Feedback: Due to the constantly changing IT landscape and the quick adoption of AI, it would be helpful to acquire more official AI training, perhaps professional certification in a specific AI platform could be beneficial to Ennead.
Technical Knowledge & Expertise Comments: The skills required to perform the array of responsibilities push me to keep my knowledge current and relevant to today and future needs.  I have developed a few different programs that Ennead can grow into as the digital workplace evolves. I often practice my trade independently of my work here at Ennead and maintain test cloud infrastructures for training and testing purposes.

Collaboration Comments: I like to involve everyone on the team and ensure everyone feels values and free to contribute their perspective and ideas.   I try not to be quick to shut down ideas i disagree with but rather consider the potential and hope to modify the path if warranted and improved to do so.

I like to directly address as soon as possible any thing that seems inconsistent with my understanding of what should be happening or how to improve on workflow.
Please share your thoughts about the cha: I think that the office is doing its best to keep up with the changing demands for architects.   We need to be more facile in the ability to make jobs and the office profitable.  How do we setup teams, studios,  in a manner to expediate expertise and minimize the learning curve and new details while maintaing the essence of what Ennead (polshek) was founded on.   Design is meant to engage the public and the people in meaningful ways and we want to push the envelope of how we do that.
Professionalism Comments: I try to bring the utmost professionalism into all conversations, especially with team members from other firms and owner.  Of course, i feel it is also okay, and warranted, to be able to have a familiar relationship with those you work with closely and often in order to 1. gain the trust of the team and create an enjoyable working environment for everyone involved.  Work is done better and more dedicated when those around you enjoy the company of their team mates and / or supervisors.

Are there specific examples of your perf: Continued building up the connections with the clients, this year, I've brought three ByteDance competitions, one JD competition (a new client), one lab project in Shenzhen and one cultural project in Shaoxing.
Areas for Growth / Development Goals: Learn more about healthcare and laboratory knowledge and integrate them into BD scenarios.
Collaboration Comments: I believe the best architectural solutions emerge from truly collaborative efforts. My approach is to facilitate and support the team, ensuring everyone—from our visionary designers to our technical staff and external partners—has a voice and feels empowered to contribute. In the China market, I see my role as a bridge, helping to synthesize diverse ideas and cultural nuances into a cohesive project direction. I am grateful for the talented teams I work with and focus on creating an environment of mutual trust and shared purpose.
Communication Comments: I strive to ensure my communication is clear and effective, whether in verbal discussions or written correspondence. I make a conscious effort to listen actively to clients, our design teams, and local partners, aiming to fully understand their perspectives and ensure we are aligned. I try to tailor my communication style to the audience, whether explaining a complex design intent to a client or coordinating technical details with our consultants. There is always room to improve, and I welcome feedback to ensure my communication remains as effective as possible.
Employee Strengths:
Communication skills.
Presentation skills.
Comprehensive skills on competitions, for concepts, visualizations, as well as business connections.
Please share your thoughts about the cha:
We are collaborative and innovative. We learn from the environments and respond with positive solutions.
We need to continue growing the design strengths that could adapt with the current technical environment and design industry. Not only applying the use of AI, but also expand our design realm to interior, visual arts, landscape if possible.
Professionalism Comments: I endeavor to uphold the highest standards of professionalism that reflect well on Ennead's reputation. This means taking full accountability for my responsibilities, meeting commitments reliably, and always acting with integrity. I try to maintain a calm and constructive demeanor, especially during challenging phases of a project, focusing on solutions rather than problems. I view professionalism as an ongoing practice and consistently look for ways to better represent our firm's values to our clients and partners.
Software & Tools Feedback: AI for graphic generation, both images and videos.
Technical Knowledge & Expertise Comments: My technical knowledge is built on a strong foundation in architectural design principles, project delivery methodologies, and business development strategies specific to the built environment. I strive to continuously learn from our technical teams and consultants to ensure our proposals and project plans are not only creative but also technically sound and feasible for the China market. This is particularly important when new market opportunities emerge, such as a shift towards sustainable design or a new building typology we will do in China, i.e. Healthcare and Institutional Laboratory.
Title: Associate Principal
What additional resources would help you: We have three offices now. By implementing structured channels for knowledge exchange and strategic alignment, we can better leverage our collective intelligence. This will allow each market to actively learn from the others' experiences, provide cross-regional support, and efficiently share resources, ultimately strengthening our firm's global position and driving unified growth.
Workflow Implementation, Management, Exe: I focus on creating and managing efficient workflows to see projects and strategic initiatives through from conception to completion. This involves coordinating closely with our design, marketing, and finance teams to develop winning proposals, and then managing the project lifecycle to deliver on those promises. I rely on our established firm-wide systems and actively seek to improve local implementation, ensuring our operations in China are seamless, integrated, and effective in supporting our creative and business goals.

Are there specific examples of your perf: I feel like everyone in the office could learn and improve on some level and I am no exception. I will continue to try to improve my abilities.
Areas for Growth / Development Goals: The profession is changing rapidly and I would like to learn new types of software that would make my workflow more productive and easier. I would like to implement more sustainable design strategies in my design process.
Collaboration Comments: I think that I collaborate effectively; however, the past few international projects have been unusual since most of the project team is in Shanghai. Direct communication is difficult w/ the time difference.
Communication Comments: I'm naturally an introverted person; however, I have no problem voicing my opinion on design-related issues. I feel that this is very important in maintaining a high level of quality for our projects. I am happy to be leading a lot of our international exterior & interior work.
Employee Strengths: 30+ years of professional experience backed up w/ my portfolio of completed projects in multiple typologies, overall design insight, precedent knowledge and vision, technical skill w/ detailing and documentation.
Please share your thoughts about the cha: Our office has the ability to target a wide variety of typologies, but I feel that a lot of the 'centers' within the office seem to operate independently from one another. It would be good to see more knowledge overlap and visual consistency within our portfolio. I think that our interior work could help bridge that gap in some regard.
Professionalism Comments: I try to be as professional as possible in all situations. I understand that my actions represent our company and our reputation. I've done a number of projects for repeat clients that seem very happy w/ my design work.
Software & Tools Feedback: I do not use all of the software listed above. For visualization, I rely on junior help. I would like to learn more about grasshopper and D5
Technical Knowledge & Expertise Comments: I have assembled an interior detail library for our future projects, and I feel that will help speed up our future endeavors. I have also mentored junior designers and have helped them understand the detailing process.
Title: Senior Associate
What additional resources would help you: I could use more software training. Prior to joining the office, I worked for companies that have a distinct design and production process using a limited number of programs, so I am unfamiliar w/ the full assortment that we have available. The international projects that I have been leading run at a very quick pace, and it has been difficult to find time to learn new programs. If the office could provide instruction, that would be helpful.
Workflow Implementation, Management, Exe: I feel that I am good w/ establishing a consistent project workflow and conveying that w/ the project team. I have also helped develop and refine our commercial marketing presentations for our residential, hospitality and interior pursuits.
